Container.Name: jsdos
Container.Overview:
This Docker will download and install jsdos, you can now play your favourite DOS games in your browser!
Simply place a zip file with your favourite DOS game in the root of the serverdirectory enter the variables in the template and play the game in your browser (By default it automatically installs CIV).
This all is powered by jsdos please also check out the website: https://js-dos.com/ and the GitHub page: https://github.com/caiiiycuk/js-dos
ATTENTION: !!!Only Install one game on one port otherwise your browser will mess up the saves and paths!!!

Config.Name: Web
Config.Description: Install only one game to one port, even if you're installing a new game (your browser will mess up the paths and savefiles)

Config.Name: Application Name
Config.Description: Based on the application name the container creates a folder in your serverdirectory.

Config.Name: ZIP Name
Config.Description: The name of the zip file wich to install, place the zip file in the root of your serverdirectory (without the extension '.zip') !!!CASE SENSITIVE!!!

Config.Name: Startfile
Config.Description: Name of the file wich the countainer should start (idealy the file should be in the root of your zip file not in a subdirectory) !!!CASE SENSITIVE!!!

Config.Name: Backgroundcolor
Config.Description: Background color for the webUI in HEX.

Config.Name: FPS Counter
Config.Description: Set to 'true' or 'false' (without quotes true=display FPS counter | false=don't display FPS counter)

Config.Name: Dosbox Variant
Config.Description: Choose your preferred variant of Dosbox possible choices are: wdosbox - default variant. This version compiled with latest emscripten and in theory should work best | wdosbox-emterp - This version compiled with legacy fastcomp backend, can be useful in rare cases (e.g. if you have problem with default version) | wdosbox-nosync - Fastest possible version, but limited. You can’t run console programs/shell emulation using it. | dosbox - same as dosbox-emterp because default version can’t be compiled to asm.js | dosbox-emterp - same as wdosbox-emterp.js but javascript (asm.js) | dosbox-nosync - same as wdosbox-nosync but javascript (asm.js)
